title: Think about how layers wrap data
text:
Encapsulation is the process by which each layer of the Internet protocol stack adds its own header (and sometimes a trailer) to the data received from the layer above. This allows the lower layer to transmit the data correctly to the next hop.

Key idea: “Take the data from the layer above → add a header for this layer → place in payload field of this layer’s packet/frame.”
